headline.main: Jeff Gordon to Meet With NASCAR to Discuss Safety Measures
headline.print_headline: Jeff Gordon to Meet With NASCAR to Discuss Safety Measures

docs.snippet: Jeff Gordon, upset after a hard hit into a concrete wall at Atlanta, said Friday he'll meet with NASCAR next week to discuss safety initiatives....

headline.main: As He Ponders 2016, O'Malley Begs Off on Criticizing Clinton
headline.print_headline: As He Ponders 2016, O'Malley Begs Off on Criticizing Clinton

docs.snippet: Former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley, who is considering a Democratic presidential bid, declined Friday to criticize likely primary opponent Hillary Rodham Clinton for her exclusive use of private email while serving as secretary of state....
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley, who is considering a Democratic presidential bid, declined Friday to criticize likely primary opponent Hillary Rodham Clinton for her exclusive use of private email while serving as secretary of state.

SOMMER--Roberta "Bobbie"

of Somers, NY, March 5. Retired social worker. Beloved wife of the late Bertram Sommer. Mother of Lorie (Alan) Mael and Jonathan (Elizabeth) Sommer. Adored grandmother and great- grandmother.

docs.snippet: GALIN--Glenda, 82, of Manhattan, died on Thursday, March 5th from complications from a stroke. She was born on September 4, 1933 in Brooklyn, NY, to Libby and Leon Goldenberg. She attended Syracuse University and graduated from Brooklyn College. S...
docs.lead_paragraph: GALIN--Glenda, 82, of Manhattan, died on Thursday, March 5th from complications from a stroke. She was born on September 4, 1933 in Brooklyn, NY, to Libby and Leon Goldenberg. She attended Syracuse University and graduated from Brooklyn College. She was a volunteer at CASA, a Francophile, an arts enthusiast and crossword puzzle maven. She is survived by Miles Galin, her children, Amy, Liza, Scott and Jon, son-in-law Benjamin and daughter in-law Jodi, her 13 grandchildren, Emma, Sam, Max, Henry, Hannah, Danny, Libby, Lucas, Frances, Justin, Rebecca, Joe, and Elias, her brother Alan and sister-in-law Rena, and her cousins, Riki, Melanie and Candy. Funeral service at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel at 9am on Sunday, March 8th. Visitors are welcome at 1735 York Avenue from 3pm-7pm.

docs.snippet: FRIEDMAN--Robert James, former White Plains City Court judge and longtime White Plains resident, died on Tuesday, March 4 at his home. He was 89. Bob lived and worked in White Plains for more than sixty years. Prior to his time on the White Plains...
docs.lead_paragraph:
FRIEDMAN--Robert James,

former White Plains City Court judge and longtime White Plains resident, died on Tuesday, March 4 at his home. He was 89. Bob lived and worked in White Plains for more than sixty years. Prior to his time on the White Plains City Court bench, he was a partner at Corwin & Friedman, a law firm established in 1953. Most recently, he was Of Counsel to Holden Brothers, P.C, also located in White Plains. Throughout his life, Bob volunteered in many organizations. He also served as a president of the White Plains Bar Association and as director of the Westchester County Bar Association. Bob was proud of his Citizen Extraordinaire award received from the White Plains Historical Society, but was even more proud of his family. He is survived by his ex-wife Florence, with whom he retained a close relationship over the years; two sons, Douglas and Andrew; and four grandchildren. The family will receive visitors at McMahon, Lyon & Hartnett Funeral Home, 491 Mamaroneck Ave., White Plains on Sunday, March 8, 3pm-7pm.
